1.title: Episode #2.1
1.plot: On the first edition of the new year Jeremy asks - What should be done with the migrants crossing the channel? Should the Queen have a new royal yacht? Are new year's resolutions pointless?

2.title: Episode #2.2
2.plot: Jeremy asks - Should patients who miss doctor's appointments be fined? Are people applying for foreign passports ahead of Brexit sensible or unpatriotic? Are vegan sausage rolls a step too far?

3.title: Episode #2.3
3.plot: Jeremy asks - Is being fat really a disease? Are bosses who have earned in the first three days of 2019 what the average worker will earn in the whole year worth their pay? Should cyclists be prioritised over cars?

4.title: Episode #2.4
4.plot: Jeremy asks his guests - Is it time to scrap Universal Credit? Is it OK to lie to get your child a place in a good school? If you earn more than your partner should you pay a greater share of your joint costs?

5.title: Episode #2.5
5.plot: Jeremy asks his guests - Is Brexit to blame for the yobs harassing MP Anna Soubry? Would you want to consult your doctor online? Are some university degrees a waste of time?

6.title: Episode #2.6
6.plot: Jeremy asks his panel of guests - Is a no-deal Brexit the ultimate nightmare? What is the point of dry January? Are board games boring? Plus, the news review.

7.title: Episode #2.7
7.plot: Jeremy asks - Are prisons too soft? Is it time to get rid of parent and child parking spaces? Were Manchester City bad sports to thrash underdogs Burton Albion?

8.title: Episode #2.8
8.plot: Jeremy asks - Should the speedboat killer Jack Shepherd be stopped from accessing legal aid while he is on the run? Should dogs be banned from playgrounds? Is Andy Murray Britain's greatest sportsman?

9.title: Episode #2.9
9.plot: Jeremy and his guests discuss - Is a no-deal Brexit a moral failure? Should short term jail sentences be scrapped? Is camping the best way to holiday or the holiday from hell?

10.title: Episode #2.10
10.plot: On the day of the vote on the Prime Minister's Brexit deal Jeremy asks - Should Brexit be scrapped? Should there be a maximum age for voters? Should white bread be taxed?

11.title: Episode #2.11
11.plot: After the massive defeat of the Prime Minister's Brexit deal Jeremy asks - Is it now time for Corbyn to take over? Is the new Gillette advert sexist to men? Do you back the experts calling for school to start an hour later?

12.title: Episode #2.12
12.plot: Jeremy discusses with his guests - Who do you blame for the Brexit mess? Is political correctness killing comedy? Is 7 too young to be visiting a beautician?

13.title: Episode #2.13
13.plot: Jeremy and his guests discuss - Is Prince Philip too old to drive? Should Jeremy Corbyn agree to meet Theresa May to try to break the Brexit deadlock? Should we all go vegan to save the planet?

14.title: Episode #2.14
14.plot: Today Jeremy and his guests discuss - Should everyone who drives to work have to pay to park? Should Patisserie Valerie be bailed out? Should Prince Philip be fined for not wearing a seat-belt?

15.title: Episode #2.15
15.plot: Jeremy asks - Do you have any sympathy for the digger driver who wrecked the hotel he helped build in a dispute over pay? Is a no-deal Brexit no problem? Should women in sport get the same pay as men?

16.title: Episode #2.16
16.plot: Today Jeremy and his guests discuss - Is James Dyson a Brexit traitor? Should the NHS deny IVF to a couple if one of them already has a child? Did Ant and Dec deserve to win best presenter award at the NTA's?

17.title: Episode #2.17
17.plot: Topics discussed today are - A British man sentenced to be caned for drug dealing in Singapore. If you can't get to work due to snow should you lose a day's holiday? Should every train have a child-free carriage?

18.title: Episode #2.18
18.plot: With violent crime on the rise is it time to take personal responsibility for our own safety? A new documentary calls Michael Jackson a sexual predator should we boycott his music? Should the UK quit the Eurovision Song Contest?

19.title: Episode #2.19
19.plot: Jeremy asks - Should the Queen intervene to sort out the Brexit mess? Should Britain roll out the red carpet for a state visit for Donald Trump? Should we teach mindfulness in schools?

20.title: Episode #2.20
20.plot: Jeremy asks - Do you fear food shortages if there is a no-deal Brexit? Should [link= be Queen? Should the number of children a family can have be capped?

21.title: Episode #2.21
21.plot: Jeremy asks - Is the EU to blame for the Brexit deadlock? Should the "fake cop" high visibility vests being worn by cyclists be banned? Would you buy a house with graves in the garden?

22.title: Episode #2.22
22.plot: Jeremy asks his panel of guests and the viewers - Is Brexit making you ill? Are plans for a new knife crime ASBO pointless? Are you fed up with fitness technology?

23.title: Episode #2.23
23.plot: Jeremy asks his guests - Why are we not ready for winter snow yet again? Is tickling children an invasion of their privacy? Should non-disabled actors play disabled characters?

24.title: Episode #2.24
24.plot: Jeremy asks - Do we need a general election to sort out the Brexit mess? Was Warwick University right to readmit a group of male students who made rape threats? Can granny trollies save the planet?

25.title: Episode #2.25
25.plot: Jeremy asks - Should Liam Neeson films be boycotted following his bizarre comments in an interview? Should we not give money to homeless people? Would you use the new male contraceptive gel?

26.title: Episode #2.26
26.plot: Jeremy asks - Should controversial former Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher have a statue in her honour? Has Brexit made Britain a more racist country? Are police wrong to tell women to jog in groups?

27.title: Episode #2.27
27.plot: Today Jeremy asks his panel of guests - Is there really a special place in hell for no-deal, no-plan Brexiteers? Should Brits be made to take the citizenship test? Would you eat a squirrel or is it a nuts idea?

28.title: Episode #2.28
28.plot: Jeremy asks his guests - Should the police work with online paedophile hunters? Is it time to say no screen time during family meal time? Should we stop buying online to save the great British high street?

29.title: Episode #2.29
29.plot: Anne Diamond stands in for Jeremy Vine. She asks - Is it time to scrap HS2? Are teachers and parents right to back school pupils walking out of school to protest against climate change? Are beauty pageants for 6-year-olds right?

30.title: Episode #2.30
30.plot: Jeremy asks - Is a post-Brexit collapse in the value of the pound a good thing as some claim? Who is in the wrong in the feud between the Markle family? How far would you go to look good?

31.title: Episode #2.31
31.plot: Today Jeremy asks - Is it now time to strip Sir Philip Green of his knighthood? Is the parking space on the street outside your home yours? If there is no Valentine's Day present is there no love?

32.title: Episode #2.32
32.plot: Jeremy asks - Should the British woman who went to Syria to join ISIS be allowed back into the UK? Should everyone join their local neighbourhood watch scheme? Should boys be allowed to play netball?

33.title: Episode #2.33
33.plot:

1.title: Episode #1.1
1.plot: Jeremy hosts the morning topical discussion show and is joined by a panel of guests to discuss the big issues of the day. Featuring an interview with actress Roxanne Pallett about departing Celebrity Big Brother (2001) and that "punch".

2.title: Episode #1.2
2.plot: Jeremy interviews actress Rose McGowan about the #MeToo movement. Journalist Martin Daubney joins the panel as they discuss accents, mental health and haggis. Plus a review of today's newspapers.

3.title: Episode #1.3
3.plot: Jeremy and today's panel of guests discuss topics including, should the wealthy pay more tax to help the poor? Should mobile phones be banned in schools? Pets behaving badly and antisemitism are also discussed.

4.title: Episode #1.4
4.plot: What should be Britain's response to the Salisbury nerve agent attack? Should police work with internet paedophile hunters? Why are cyclists so hated? These topics and more are discussed.

5.title: Episode #1.5
5.plot: Should the UK follow Scotland's lead and ban smacking children? Should 1st Class be scrapped on busy trains? The panel of guests will also discuss sex on TV. Includes the TV review/preview.

6.title: Episode #1.6
6.plot: Is Boris Johnson fit to be Prime Minister? Should parents be held responsible for the actions of their children? Panellist Hardeep Singh Kohli discusses his time in the Celebrity Big Brother (2001) house.

7.title: Episode #1.7
7.plot: Do you back Jacob Rees-Mogg's vision of Brexit? Can you be too posh? Are have-a-go heroes fearless or foolish? Plus a review of the days news.

8.title: Episode #1.8
8.plot: Is twitter evil? Is it the end for free TV licences for the over 75s? Should bears be reintroduced in the UK? Plus, Jeremy speaks to Celebrity Big Brother (2001) winner Ryan Thomas.

9.title: Episode #1.9
9.plot: Are we treating our politicians like public servants or public enemies? How old is too old to be a mother? Is watching porn cheating on your partner? Stand-in presenter Anne Diamond discusses these topics with the panel.

10.title: Episode #1.10
10.plot: Is the Archbishop of Canterbury a hypocrite? Should rebel MPs quit their parties? Do extra marital affairs matter anymore? Plus the news review and Kevin O'Sullivan's television guide.

11.title: Episode #1.11
11.plot: Is the BBC right to snub the wedding of Princess Eugenie? Is it right to self-diagnose via the internet? Should you give your children equal amounts of money? These and other topics are discussed.

12.title: Episode #1.12
12.plot: Topics discussed include - Should a controversial American preacher be banned from entering the UK? Is shouting at your children a form of child abuse? Are jokes about being fat wrong?

13.title: Episode #1.13
13.plot: Jeremy asks - Is there still a stigma attached to living in a council house? Is it time to call time on the drinking at freshers' week? Have you used technology to keep track of your partner?

14.title: Episode #1.14
14.plot: Topics include - Should the Labour Party back a 2nd Brexit vote? Should those with self-inflicted illnesses go to the back of the queue? Is sibling rivalry healthy? Are Carry On films still funny?

15.title: Episode #1.15
15.plot: Jeremy asks - Should prison sentences for the under 25's be cut? Should vaccinations for children be compulsory? How soon is too soon to do your Christmas shopping? Plus the news review and TV preview.

16.title: Episode #1.16
16.plot: Should the German President be invited to attend a ceremony at the Cenotaph? Should sales reps be banned from maternity wards? Are social media and catch-up TV incompatible?

17.title: Episode #1.17
17.plot: Jeremy asks - Should we all be in therapy? Is it a betrayal if Labour back calls for a second vote on Brexit? If someone shoplifts because their family are going hungry should they be let off?

18.title: Episode #1.18
18.plot: The panel discuss whether cyclists should have number plates on their bikes and the argument that children are given too much homework, as well as the need to import conkers from Germany as the British versions are too small.

19.title: Episode #1.19
19.plot: Jeremy and his panel of guests discuss - Can Jeremy Corbyn cut it as Prime Minister? Is Edinburgh right to slap a tax on tourists? Is it time puddings were banned from school meals?

20.title: Episode #1.20
20.plot: Jeremy asks if police should get more money to continue the search for Madeleine McCann or should the investigation be ended? Is homework a waste of time? Plus the news review and the TV preview.

21.title: Episode #1.21
21.plot: Jeremy Vine asks if it is time for Boris Johnson to put up or shut up? He also interviews Samantha Grant Markle the sister of Meghan Markle. Plus the news review.

22.title: Episode #1.22
22.plot: Jeremy asks - Are local councils wrong to re-brand Black History Month to include other ethnic groups? Are home deliveries driving you mad? Can babies be harmed by 18 rated films?

23.title: Episode #1.23
23.plot: Jeremy and his guests discuss - Is it right to send your children to private school? Would you pay to choose your baby's gender? Plus reaction to Boris Johnson's speech at the Conservative Party conference.

24.title: Episode #1.24
24.plot: Jeremy and his guests discuss - Has Theresa May saved her job with her performance at conference? Is it right to give young people advice on how to safely take drugs? Should a 6-year-old shave her legs?

25.title: Episode #1.25
25.plot: Today's topics of discussion include - Growing evidence of Russia's meddling in the West, boys' body image, Shetland no longer appearing inside a box on maps, the spiders that have closed down schools.

26.title: Episode #1.26
26.plot: Jeremy and his guests discuss - Should we be scared of Russia? Are shared GP appointments a good idea? Would you forgive your partner a drunken kiss? The age old question of scones, jam and cream is debated.

27.title: Episode #1.27
27.plot: Jeremy asks - Was the police chief who locked himself in his car during the Westminster terrorist attack right to do so? Is tough love for anorexics acceptable? Should the snogging Strictly contestant and dancer be dumped?

28.title: Episode #1.28
28.plot: Was a council right to ask homeless people to move on ahead of Princess Eugenie's wedding? Should school uniforms be ditched? Should old people give up their homes for the young?

29.title: Episode #1.29
29.plot: Was the supreme court right to rule in favour of the bakery in the gay cake row? Will you be voting to keep Seann Walsh on Strictly after his public apology? Should dogs be banned from sports pitches?

30.title: Episode #1.30
30.plot: Should taxpayers pay for the royal wedding? Were M&S wrong to sell a hijab to children? Should a transgender rapist have been sent to a women's prison? Plus the news and TV reviews.

31.title: Episode #1.31
31.plot: Is it now time to accept a no deal on Brexit? Should schools teach children about the injustices of Empire? Is it irresponsible for parents to provide alcohol for teen parties?

32.title: Episode #1.32
32.plot: Jeremy and his guests discuss - Would you pay more tax to save the NHS? Should Margaret Thatcher be the new face of the fifty pound note? Is it OK for men to wear make-up?

33.title: Episode #1.33
33.plot: Jeremy asks - Does anyone take notice of protest marches? Is it wrong to weigh children? Should we all pay more for alcohol to help fund treatment for alcoholics? Plus the news review.

34.title: Episode #1.34
34.plot: Jeremy asks - Should hate preacher Anjem Choudary be allowed out of prison? Are women-only parking bays sexist? Is it too soon in Harry and Meghan's marriage for them to have a baby?

35.title: Episode #1.35
35.plot: Jeremy and his panel of guests discuss - Have we lost the war on crime? Are you offended by Disney princesses? Should motorists have to give way to cyclists and pedestrians?

36.title: Episode #1.36
36.plot: Anne Diamond sits in for Jeremy and asks - Should Theresa May be given more time to get a Brexit deal? Do you want fireworks banned? Would you eat insects?

37.title: Episode #1.37
37.plot: Anne asks her guests - Is it time to scrap free television licences for the over 75s? Is it a good idea to get children to clean their classrooms? Is it right to use children's voices to shame smokers?

38.title: Episode #1.38
38.plot: Anne asks - Should the press name the businessman accused of sexual and racial abuse? Is it right to wear a white poppy? Are you sick of parents sharing too much information on social media?

39.title: Episode #1.39
39.plot: Anne Diamond asks - Should trophy hunting be banned? Are we to blame for the death of the high street? Should Ryanair be boycotted over a racist rant? Are gingerbread-men sexist?

40.title: Episode #1.40
40.plot: Anne asks - Should Sir Philip Green be stripped of his knighthood? Is 15 too old to go trick or treating? Is it time to stop changing the clocks? Plus the news and TV reviews.

41.title: Episode #1.41
41.plot: Will the budget bring the end of austerity? Is 55 too old to become a dad? Should kids with rotten teeth be referred to social services? Should universities that benefited from slavery repay the money?

42.title: Episode #1.42
42.plot: Jeremy asks his panel of guests what they made of the budget. Plus, should national service be reintroduced? Is Halloween dangerous?

43.title: Episode #1.43
43.plot: Jeremy asks - If you attack a member of NHS staff should you be refused free treatment in future? Is it right to spy on your children's phone? Should women be given time off work for the menopause?

44.title: Episode #1.44
44.plot: Jeremy asks - Should the police be focusing on tackling violent crime not hate speech? Should the rich be taxed until they squeak? Is it ever OK to park in a disabled space if you aren't disabled? Is the party over for airport boozers?

45.title: Episode #1.45
45.plot: Jeremy asks - Is the government right to delay a decision on the future of fix-odds betting terminals? Why don't airlines weigh passengers instead of bags? Should using mobile phones while walking be banned?

46.title: Episode #1.46
46.plot: Jeremy asks his guests - Should bouncy castles be banned? Should teachers have to teach unruly kids? Can a cheat ever be a hero? Would you pay more tax to help the elderly?

47.title: Episode #1.47
47.plot: Topics discussed by Jeremy and his guests include - should the death penalty be reintroduced? Are baby-boomers the real snowflakes? Have we lost the true meaning of Christmas?

48.title: Episode #1.48
48.plot: Jeremy asks - Is it time to put a tax on red meat? Are prisoners being paid ten pound a week to make remembrance poppies being exploited? Has feminism made men more ambitious?

49.title: Episode #1.49
49.plot: Today Jeremy asks if the burning of a Grenfell Tower effigy was a crime? Should military veterans be given special treatment? Is President Trump wrong to attack the media?

50.title: Episode #1.50
50.plot: Jeremy asks - Should the royals skip Charles and make William the next King? Are private landlords right to snub benefit claimants? Are cots with a built in iPad just a sign of bad parenting?

51.title: Episode #1.51
51.plot: Jeremy discusses with his panel of guests - Should a tax for the over 40s be introduced to pay for social care? Has IVF made adoption a last resort? Is it wrong to ban the Iceland Christmas advert?

52.title: Episode #1.52
52.plot: Jeremy discusses with his guests - Would you kill a burglar to protect your home? Should the over 70s be forced to retake their driving test? Are we hypocrites when it comes to women's behaviour at male strip shows?

53.title: Episode #1.53
53.plot: Jeremy asks - Should the cabinet back the Prime Minister over her draft Brexit deal? Is talking about stillbirth still taboo? Were the killers of James Bulger born evil?

54.title: Episode #1.54
54.plot: Jeremy asks - Can the Prime Minister survive the resignation of a second Brexit secretary? Is Donald Trump evil or a genius? Is it right to put children in isolation at school?

55.title: Episode #1.55
55.plot: Jeremy asks his guests - Do you still have confidence in the Prime Minister? Do speeding cyclists need to be warned? Should schools ban pupils from wearing designer clothing?

56.title: Episode #1.56
56.plot: Jeremy asks - Are you scared of a no-deal Brexit? Is it OK to put children in isolation at school? Do we really need an International Men's Day?

57.title: Episode #1.57
57.plot: Jeremy discusses with his guests - Should we legalise red light districts? Were the BBC film crew wrong to help penguins escape from a ravine? What do you make of the father of five crowdfunding Christmas?

58.title: Episode #1.58
58.plot: Jeremy discusses with his guests - Should the public step in and help the police? Should smoking be banned in social housing? Are children making Christmas list being encouraged to be greedy?

59.title: Episode #1.59
59.plot: Jeremy asks his guests - Is it right to blame parents for obese children? Are a council justified in installing bollards to deter beggars? Is Black Friday a con and why has it been introduced to the UK when we don't have Thanksgiving?

60.title: Episode #1.60
60.plot: Jeremy asks - Does Denise Coates deserve her 265 million pound salary? Is a school right to inform the police about truant pupils? Should police question the tribe who killed an American missionary?

61.title: Episode #1.61
61.plot: Jeremy asks - Is the police policy of ramming moped riding criminals off their bikes wrong? Is it the duty of MP's to back the Brexit deal? Do teachers deserve a day off to Christmas shop?

62.title: Episode #1.62
62.plot: Jeremy asks his guests - Is Britain workshy? Is a school right to "ban" Christmas? Should dogs be banned from bars and restaurants? Plus, the news review.

63.title: Episode #1.63
63.plot: Today Jeremy asks - Should the children filmed bullying a Syrian refugee at their school be named? Are selfie Christmas cards self indulgent? Is the care system failing children?

64.title: Episode #1.64
64.plot: Jeremy discusses with his guests - Are predictions of Brexit doom just Project Hysteria? Is smoking in cars more dangerous than using mobile phones? Are you team Meghan or team Kate?

65.title: Episode #1.65
65.plot: Jeremy asks - Should doctors keep family illness secret? Should busy roads near schools be closed at peak times to cut pollution? Is working with your family a good idea? Plus, talking television.

66.title: Episode #1.66
66.plot: Today Jeremy asks - Does Baby P's mother deserve a second chance and access to her other children? Is Donald Trump a national embarrassment for Americans? Should energy drinks be banned?

67.title: Episode #1.67
67.plot: Jeremy and his guess debate - Should absent parents have their passports confiscated? Should the British be more like the French and have street protests? Should we end the giving of gifts to teachers?

68.title: Episode #1.68
68.plot: Jeremy asks - Should Theresa May resign? Is it safe to keep snakes as pets? Are over the top Christmas lights ruining your street? Plus, the news review.

69.title: Episode #1.69
69.plot: Jeremy asks his guests - Is crowdfunding begging? Should drink drivers go straight to jail? Is OK for bosses to tell staff to lose weight or lose pay?

70.title: Episode #1.70
70.plot: Jeremy discusses - The mobile phone outage that hit the O2 network, the footballers filmed inhaling nitrous oxide at a party and the father who shamed his bullying daughter by making her walk to school.

71.title: Episode #1.71
71.plot: Jeremy asks - should football clubs be punished for abusive supporters? Should all shops be closed on Boxing Day? Should prisoners be allowed to have mobiles phones?

72.title: Episode #1.72
72.plot: Jeremy asks his guests - Is it time to cancel Brexit? Is it right that a murderer did not appear in court for sentencing? Should pantomime be made more politically correct for modern audiences?

73.title: Episode #1.73
73.plot: Jeremy asks - Can Theresa May survive the challenge to her leadership? Should cyclists be registered and wear their registration number? Is Christmas sexist?

74.title: Episode #1.74
74.plot: Jeremy asks - After Theresa May won the vote of confidence should Tory rebels now back her? Should every police officer be armed with a taser? Do comedians have the right to offend?

75.title: Episode #1.75
75.plot: Jeremy asks his guests - Are the older generation betraying the young over Brexit? Should schoolchildren be forced to exercise? Is kissing someone under the mistletoe at the office party cheating?

76.title: Episode #1.76
76.plot: Jeremy asks - Was Meghan Markle right to refuse to attend the traditional Boxing Day royal shoot? Is it time to ban the sale of alcohol at airports? Do Christmas presents spoil children?

77.title: Episode #1.77
77.plot: Should MP's cancel their Christmas break to try and sort out the Brexit chaos? Is it finders keepers or is honesty the best policy? Is the gender fluid panto dame political correctness gone mad?

78.title: Episode #1.78
78.plot: Jeremy asks - Is José Mourinho's fifteen million pound payment from Manchester United obscene? Is making your child an Instagram star child exploitation? Is it OK to lay booby traps for thieves?

79.title: Episode #1.79
79.plot: Jeremy asks - should Jeremy Corbyn apologise for his stupid remark in parliament? What's so wrong with airbrushing photos? Should Christmas jumpers for dogs be banned?

80.title: Episode #1.80
80.plot: Jeremy asks - Should the the drones the drones that brought chaos to Gatwick have been shot down? Should talk of Brexit be banned at the Christmas dinner table? Should kids be forced to watch the queens speech?

81.title: The Best of Jeremy Vine 2018
81.plot: A selection of highlights of the first year of the topical discussion show hosted by broadcaster Jeremy Vine. Featuring the most provocative, entertaining and controversial moments.

imdb.title: Jeremy Vine
plot: '_Jeremy Vine_ (qv)' (qv) hosts a topical discussion show, replacing long-running topical show _The Wright Stuff (2000)_ (qv) on weekday mornings. Vine and his panel of guests discuss the stories making the news before the debate is thrown open to the viewers.::Mark_a_Wood <markawood@hotmail.co.uk>
